left_text: Forewing length commonly (but not always) over 4 mm, wing venation usually not greatly reduced (for a meliponine), but if minute and with some of the wing reduction characters listed below, then upper margin of hind tibia with plumose hairs intermixed with simple ones (as in Fig. 120-11a); hind wing commonly with cells R and Cu closed by at least weakly brownish veins; forewing with one or two submarginal crossveins usually weakly indicated, ﬁrst submarginal cell usually recognizable; cell second Cu of forewing completely indicated at least by faint veins; vein M of forewing usually extending at least slightly beyond position of anterior end of ﬁrst recurrent vein and angulate at end of that vein (as in Fig. 120-1c), which is usually at least faintly visible
